Pre-Game Insights: Both India and Bangladesh have won two out of three matches in the T20 World Cup.
India come into the game on the back of a disappointing loss to South Africa, but have looked good as a unit with the duo of Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav standing out with the bat.
Although India come into the game as the favorites, Rohit Sharma and Co. will be wary of what Bangladesh are capable of doing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A relatively high-scoring game is expected at the Adelaide Oval with the average score being 161.
The dimensions of the ground should play into the hands of the bowlers, who should get some help off the surface as well.
Dew could play a role in the second innings.
Others: Litton Das is perhaps Bangladesh's best batter in this format with 1318 runs in 63 matches.
Virat Kohli has been the standout batter in the Super 12 phase, scoring 156 runs in three matches.
Shakib Al Hasan is an elite all-rounder with 2230 runs and 125 wickets to his name in this format.
Arshdeep Singh has been brilliant with the ball in the tournament, picking up seven wickets in three matches.
